thread.title: The week in numbers to Sept 4
thread.title_full: The week in numbers to Sept 4

author: news.com.au
title: The week in numbers to Sept 4
text:
THE big and small numbers that grabbed attention - or should have - in the business world over the past week.
MONDAY: $300.3 million - Full year losses at troubled education provider Vocation have blown out to more than $300 million, from $3.5 million in 2013/14. Vocation is facing a class action based on its diving shares after criticism of its services.
Tuesday: 49.7 - Chinese manufacturing activity fell into contraction in August, with an official index on Tuesday slumping to a three-year low. The official Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) came in at 49.7 in August, worse than July's 50.0 reading and the first contraction since February. Wednesday: 69.89 (US cents) - The Australian dollar twice dipped to new a six-year low - below 70 US cents - on Wednesday, rocked by weaker-than-expected economic growth and a slowdown in Chinese manufacturing. Its lowest point for the day, 69.89 US cents. Thursday: -0.1 per cent - Australian retail spending fell 0.1 per cent in July, its first monthly fall since May, 2014. Friday: 12,000 - Almost 12,000 US students are asking the federal government to discharge their college loan debt, asserting that their school either closed or lied to them about job prospects.
